name: Fira
headline: Financial research assistant for investment firms
description:
Fira is a financial research assistant that helps analysts at investment firms instantly extract and analyse data from unstructured reports of public and private companies. It reads thousands of integrated unstructured financial reports (often 300 pages) to provide source-cited answers, verifiable financial calculations, and Excel-ready tables — tasks that typically take hours.

We're initially focusing on boutique investment banks and small private equity firms, covering annual reports of international companies and allowing to upload custom documents. As we develop our product and build clients' trust, we'll eventually integrate directly into clouds.

Using accurate extraction and analysis as single unit of work LLMs do, our vision is to scale it with agents to allow deeper and more thoughtful research, report generation and task execution — allowing financial teams to focus on ideas and decisions.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:generative-ai; industry:b2b; industry:market-research; industry:ai-assistant; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Alexey Taktarov, Founder
founders.description:
CTO at Fira. Previously, co-founded and engineered resume.io (+26 local sites cv.dk, cvapp.es, cvapp.mx, ...) 
Scaled from 0 to 45M+ users, $50M ARR. Got acquired by Talent Inc in 2021. Post-acquisition, launched career.io, largest career-services platform.

Open-source dev, author of wouter - React router with 7k stars and 300k downloads/mo. Design Engineer. MSc (Math & CS)

founders.name: Alex Tkachenko, Founder
founders.description: CEO at Fira. Previously founded on-chain user analytics startup Hashscan and created crypto portfolio tracker app Hodler that was sold.

generated_description:
# Fira: Revolutionizing Financial Research

Fira is a promising startup that's taking a bold step into the world of financial analysis. Founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W25, Fira's mission is clear: to serve as a financial research assistant for investment firms, particularly focusing on boutique investment banks and small private equity firms.

## What Does Fira Do?

Imagine trying to make sense of a 300-page financial report. It’s a daunting task. Fira’s technology enables financial analysts to swiftly extract and analyze crucial data from unstructured reports—be it public or private. By processing thousands of integrated financial documents, Fira provides precise, source-cited answers and Excel-ready tables in a fraction of the time it typically takes. This allows analysts to move past tedious data gathering and focus on what truly matters: making informed investment decisions.

### Key Features:

- **Accurate Extraction**: Fira uses advanced AI tailored for finance to sift through integrated UK company filings, ensuring the data provided is not just fast but also reliable and trustworthy.
  
- **Instant Insights**: Analysts can run queries, perform general research, and benchmark company KPIs, all while having the backing of source citations for transparency.

- **Excel Integration**: With the click of a button, users can transform financial metrics into Excel tables, making it easier to analyze and present data.

- **Custom Document Uploads**: As they grow, Fira plans to allow clients to upload their specific documents for tailored insights.

## The Vision

Fira’s long-term vision is ambitious. They aim to leverage LLMs (Large Language Models) combined with cutting-edge agent technology. This will not only bolster the research capabilities but also enhance report generation and task execution, streamlining workflows for financial teams.

## Team and Background

Based in San Francisco, Fira operates with a lean team of just two employees, under the guidance of Gustaf Alstromer, a seasoned Group Partner at Y Combinator. This compact setup allows for agility and focused development within the various components of their innovative platform.

## Why Fira Matters

In a world where time is money, Fira saves precious hours for financial analysts, letting them shift their focus from menial data extraction to impactful analysis and strategic decision-making. Their approach is emblematic of a more efficient future in financial research.

If you're intrigued and want to learn more, you can check out their website: [Fira Research](https://firaresearch.com/).

In summary, Fira is not just another startup—it's a solution to a persistent problem in the finance sector. By simplifying and accelerating financial research, they're poised to make waves in an industry that’s ready for disruption.
